intro: Corchorus furcatus, commonly known as the spiny pigweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are ovate with serrated edges and can have a slightly hairy texture. Corchorus furcatus is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in arid conditions.
